markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody:
# --description-- Use padding to adjust the spacing within an element. In `.frame`, use the `padding` shorthand property to increase the space between the `.frame` and `.canvas` elements by `50px`. The shorthand will increase space in the top, bottom, left, and right of the element's border and canvas within. # --hints-- You should set the `padding` property to `50px`. ```js const hasPadding = new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getCSSRules().some(x => x.style.padding === '50px'); assert(hasPadding); ``` Your `.frame` element should have a `padding` value of `50px`. ```js const framePadding = new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('.frame')?.getPropertyValue('padding'); assert(framePadding === '50px'); ``` # --seed-- ## --seed-contents-- ```css .canvas { width: 500px; height: 600px; background-color: #4d0f00; } .frame { border: 50px solid black; width: 500px; --fcc-editable-region-- --fcc-editable-region-- } ``` ```html Rothko Painting
```
